metadata.name: Road to the Eclipse
metadata.description:
On November 8, 2022, a total Lunar Eclipse occurred.  I had photographed many lunar eclipses before but had never done a wide-field composite to my liking.  My initial idea was to just get the composite shots and a landscape, but when the car drove by, I decided to get some light trails to add to the scene.  I'm glad I did, because it added interest and some leading lines in the composition.  The base shot was taken at blue-hour as the eclipsed moon was setting.  

Photographer: Jason Betzner

Collection: Lunar

Edition: 1/1

Location: Williamsburg, Virginia, USA

Year Created: 2022

Genre: Astrophotography

Gear: Canon EOS 6D, Canon EF 20mm f 2.8 

Extended Editorial License: Can be used to display privately, or in commercial and non-commercial settings, or in groups with an unlimited number of participants. The License includes unlimited use and display in virtual or physical galleries, documentaries, and essays by the NFT holder. Provides no rights to create commercial merchandise.
